data.title: State Water Board readopts emergency drought regulation for Mill and Deer Creeks
data.excerpt: As sustained drought conditions reduce water in streams and rivers to critical levels, the State Water Resources Control Board yesterday readopted an emergency curtailment regulation for Mill and Deer Creeks in Tehama County to preserve minimum flows for the survival of multiple fish species and protect threatened drinking water supplies. The existing one-year regulation would … Read more
data.author: Kalin Kipling
